definition: lit. eyes and eyebrows come and go (idiom); to make eyes/to exchange flirting glances with sb
eyebrow/upper margin
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: After flirting with it for weeks, Greek debt was finally given a junk rating.
sentences.chinese: 经过数周的眉来眼去，希腊债务最终被定为垃圾级。

sentences.english: My boss is giving me the eye.
You often flirt with every girl you met.
sentences.chinese: 你常常对你所见的每个女孩子眉来眼去。

sentences.english: She bowed in response to his compliment and fluttered her eyelashes in an attempt to flirt with him.
sentences.chinese: 她低着头响应他的赞美，并眨着睫毛跟他眉来眼去。

sentences.english: They've been spending a lot of time together, nudge nudge, wink wink.
sentences.chinese: 他们老混在一起，眉来眼去，卿卿我我的。

definition: to make sheep eyes at/to cast amorous glances at
to carry on intimately with (idiom); ardent relationship (esp. between lovers)/billing and cooing
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
to bill and coo (idiom)/to whisper sweet nothings to one another/to be very much in love
(coll.) to have an affair
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
to echo one another (idiom)
to flirt
to throw amorous or flirtatious glances at sb (esp. of a woman)
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
adultery
to put on a rival show (idiom); to set oneself up against sb/to get into confrontation
to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)
to make hanky-panky/to seduce women
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
